intro: Helicia sellae-montis, commonly known as the mountain helicia, is a small evergreen shrub native to the high-altitude regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes plants such as camellias and tea. The plant features dense, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, fragrant flowers in shades of white and pink, followed by spherical, woody fruits. Helicia sellae-montis is well adapted to cool, humid climates and is often found in mountainous forests.
